thread.title: NFL investigating Johnny Manziel over highway incident with girlfriend
thread.title_full: NFL investigating Johnny Manziel over highway incident with girlfriend

title: NFL investigating Johnny Manziel over highway incident with girlfriend
text:
NFL investigating Johnny Manziel over highway incident with girlfriend Resize Text By Marissa Payne October 20 at 2:25 PM Follow @marissapayne (Aaron Josefczyk/AP) 
As expected, the NFL has confirmed it’s looking into the highway incident that occurred last week involving Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel and his girlfriend Colleen Crowley. 
“It is standard procedure to look into any incident that is a potential violation of our personal conduct policy,” NFL spokesman Brian McCarthy told the Associated Press on Monday, the same day that police in Avon, Ohio, released dash cam video that recorded the bizarre Oct. 12 incident. 
While police ultimately decided not to charge Manziel, whose car came to the attention of witnesses after they said he was driving at a high speed along the shoulder of Interstate 90 and cutting across several lanes to exit, some of the statements made by Crowley in the video will likely be looked into more by the NFL. In the video, Crowley can be heard saying Manziel “hit me a couple times.” Crowley, who officers noted was intoxicated at the time, declined to press charges. 
Manziel, meanwhile, who spent part of the offseason in an alcohol rehabilitation facility, admitted he, too, had been drinking alcohol earlier in the day, but he denied hitting Crowley. He said he grabbed her once to stop her from jumping out of the moving vehicle. 
In one of the most interesting moments of the video, Manziel’s teammate lineman Paul Kruger arrives to the scene apparently just by happenstance. Crowley goes on to complain “it’s not fair” that he was there. Kruger, meanwhile, tells police, “She’s not the right one he should be with.” 
On Friday, shortly after news of the incident first broke, Manziel and Crowley both said they were still together, however. They took to social media to chalk the incident up to a simple couple’s argument. 
“Colleen and I got into a dumb public argument on the way home Monday afternoon,” Manziel tweeted Friday . “It probably looked more interesting than it was and I know I would stop and check if I saw a couple arguing on the side of the road. It was embarrassing but not serious and when we talked to the police and they realized everything was alright and I was sober, we went home together and everything is fine.” 
Crowley added on Instagram, “J & I are good.” 
According to Manziel in the dash cam video, the dispute began when Manziel said he wanted to pick up another friend. Crowley objected and tossed his wallet out of the vehicle’s window. 
The NFL has not released a timeline about when it might decide on the matter. 
[ Bill Cowher says he would cut Manziel ] 
The Browns, meanwhile, have decided to keep Manziel listed as active for now. 
“We’ve dealt with it, it’s not like we ignored it,” Coach Mike Pettine said at a Monday afternoon press conference (via the AP) . “Until we had all the information from the police and when the league concludes their report we’ll have a more total picture of what happened. But given the details that we had, we made our decision based on the details we had in hand.” 
The Browns are set to take on the St. Louis Rams on Sunday. Marissa Payne writes for The Early Lead, a fast-breaking sports blog, where she focuses on what she calls the “cultural anthropological” side of sports, aka “mostly the fun stuff.” She is also an avid WWE fan. sports Success!
